titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Erwin Ramsdell Goodenough Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:15

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, writings, lectures, research notes, correspondence, personal papers and photographs possibly used in some of his publications. The largest part of the papers is comprised of research materials and manuscript drafts for Erwin Goodenough's major work, Jewish Symbols in the Greco-Roman Period (published 1953-1965), as well as materials relating to The Politics of Philo Judaeus: Practice and Theory .

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Erwin Ramsdell Goodenough, 1961; Cynthia G. Goodenough, 1975, 1978, 1995; Thomas Kraabel, 2003, and John D. Gordan, III, 2010, 2012; Semitic Museum, Harvard University, 2012.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Erwin Ramsdell Goodenough Papers (MS 723). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Erwin R. Goodenough, educator, received a B.A. degree from Hamilton College in 1915. He was a student at Drew Theological Seminary from 1915 to 1916, and received his S.T.B. from Garrett Biblical Institute in 1917. Goodenough studied at Harvard for three years until 1920, and received a D.Phil. degree from Oxford University in 1923. He was an instructor of history at Yale, 1923-1926; assistant professor, 1926-1931; associate professor, 1931-1934; professor of history of religion, 1934-1959; the John A. Hoober professor of religion, 1959-1962; and professor emeritus, 1962-1965.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence, writings, lectures, research notes, correspondence, personal papers and photographs possibly used in some of his publications. The largest part of the papers is comprised of research materials and manuscript drafts for Erwin Goodenough's major work, Jewish Symbols in the Greco-Roman Period (published 1953-1965), as well as materials relating to The Politics of Philo Judaeus: Practice and Theory .

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of eleven bound volumes of material, titled Philo , relating to Goodenough's book The Politics of Philo Judaeus: Practice and Theory and two bound volumes containing the original handwritten manuscript and the typescript of Jurisprudence of the Jewish Courts of Egypt , done in collaboration with Howard Lehman Goodhart.

This accession includes volumes II-XII of Philo . Volume I is included in accession 2013-M-019. Volumes II-V, VIII-X contain book by book bibliographical information with occasional photographs of a page; volumes III and V also have some correspondence concerning acquisition of information interspersed. Volume VII consists of correspondence with Dr. Foakes-Jackson, a collaborator who withdrew from the project, and some bibliographical essays (one of which appears twice in other volumes). Volume VI contains the corrected page proofs and Volume XI is the typescript of the book. Volume XII contains post-publication correspondence, primarily addressed to Howard Goodhart, concerning things such as reviews, book distribution, and appreciation.

unittitle.title: The Jurisprudence of the Jewish Courts in Egypt at the Time of the Early Roman Empire as Described by Philo Judaeus

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of nine boxes of brief, general lecture notes hand-written on 3x5 index cards. Topics include: church and state, philosophy, psychology of religion, Justin Martyr and the Reformation. Box 10 consists of one folder of correspondence (two letters and a postcard), one folder of negatives and three folders of photographs with notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists volume I of Philo , which gathers together material related to Goodenough's book The Politics of Philo Judaeus: Practice and Theory. Volumes II-XII of Philo form part of the materials included in accession 2011-M-015. Volume I consists of a typewritten bibliography of manuscripts, books, and articles related to the work of the Philo Judaeus. Many entries in the bibliography include detailed physical descriptions of individual works. The volume also includes an alphabetized index. Handwritten notes in Greek appear throughout the volume.
